activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Seth J. Granger

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Payment application agreement
The original history event date is: 11-03-2022
Letter to Judge re: jail sentence
Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights - AMENDED

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Seth J. Granger in court. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Seth J. Granger. Svehlek state there is an agreement almost finalized - needs to complete paperwork. Bond continued. adj. 03:38 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Seth J. Granger in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Seth J. Granger. Svehlek states has offer that anticipates expunction - is researching. Sowinski has no objection. Bond continued. adj. 03:16 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with Juvenile listed in complaint J.M.

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski. appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Seth J. Granger appeared in court, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Seth J. Granger. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski statement to review hearing in Defendant's other case 20CM164 - Branch 1 case - would like to remove from calendar and extend agreement. Counsel to contact Branch I JA. Svehlek/Sowinski statement to bond. Court modifies bond conditions. adj. 11:10 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with M.W. and juvenile listed in the complaint J.M.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Seth J. Granger appeared by video, in custody. Complaint to be provided to Defendant - court explains counts, right to counsel. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video - states she will be representing. Pfeifer/Svehlek statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on residence. Svehlek would like to set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. Court sets bond. adj. 01:26 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
